etymology.description: Depicts two entangled ropes -> to entangle; to intertwine
etymology.interpretation: The character 丩(丩) (jiū, 'twist') is a pictogram representing two ropes intertwined, which visually conveys the idea of twisting or entangling. This intuitively illustrates its meaning.

examples.chinese: 他用力丩动绳子(他用力丩動繩子)，试图将木桩固定(試圖將木樁固定)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yònglì jiū dòng shéngzi, shìtú jiāng mùzhuāng gùdìng.
examples.english: He twisted the rope with force, attempting to secure the wooden stake.

examples.chinese: 她用手丩起一条细绳(她用手丩起一條細繩)，编织成美丽的饰品(編織成美麗的飾品)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒu jiū qǐ yītiáo xìshéng, biānzhī chéng měilì de shìpǐn.
examples.english: She twisted a fine rope with her hand, weaving it into beautiful ornaments.
